intro: Knautia illyrica, commonly known as the Illyrian knautia, is a flowering plant native to the Balkan Peninsula. It is a member of the Caprifoliaceae family and is characterized by its showy, clustered inflorescences of pink to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils and thrives in full sun. It has palmately lobed leaves and produces small, oval fruits that contain several seeds. Knautia illyrica is valued for its ornamental appeal and is often cultivated in gardens for its vibrant blooms.
